info.author: Ryan Gonzalez
info.description:
bluesnow
========

BlueSnow is a basic tool powered by pip that packages your Python applications into a
single script.

Note that, at the moment, custom package data is not supported.

Installation
************

::

  $ pip install bluesnow

Usage via setup.py plugin
*************************

Put this in your ``setup.py``:

.. code-block:: python

  try:
      import bluesnow
      cmdclass = bluesnow.setuptools_cmdclass
  except ImportError:
      cmdclass = {}

  setup(
      # Normal stuff here...
      cmdclass=cmdclass,
  )

Now just run ``python setup.py bluesnow`` to compile your entry points. The results will
be placed in the ``bluesnow-out`` directory.

Usage from command line
***********************

You can also use BlueSnow from the command line, e.g.::

  $ bluesnow 'my_entry_point = my_module:my_function'

The entry points follow the `standard entry point specification
<http://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pkg_resources.html#creating-and-parsing>`_. Use
``bluesnow -h`` for more options.
info.name: bluesnow
info.summary: Package your Python applications into a single script
info.html_description:
BlueSnow is a basic tool powered by pip that packages your Python applications into a single script.

Note that, at the moment, custom package data is not supported.

Installation

$ pip install bluesnow

Usage via setup.py plugin

Put this in your setup.py:

try:
    import bluesnow
    cmdclass = bluesnow.setuptools_cmdclass
except ImportError:
    cmdclass = {}

setup(
    # Normal stuff here...
    cmdclass=cmdclass,
)

Now just run python setup.py bluesnow to compile your entry points. The results will be placed in the bluesnow-out directory.

Usage from command line

You can also use BlueSnow from the command line, e.g.:

$ bluesnow 'my_entry_point = my_module:my_function'

The entry points follow the standard entry point specification. Use bluesnow -h for more options.
